Author: Sad_Extreme
Text: I was telling a friend who recently lost like 30 lbs in like 2 months about a delicious restaurant where I had the most filling 400 cal vegan bowl and she told me 400 calories was a lot. And while restrictive me would agree (it would’ve been my only meal of the day), it also made me so worried about her. She was jealous of my weight loss and stopped eating to do like me and I feel like I’m the one who made her sick. 400 calories for lunch is not a lot by normal standards...

Author: Saakkkaaaaiiiii
Text: Maybe you’re just hyper-aware of what they do and don’t eat? If one of my friends skips a meal I freak the fuck out and they’re just like... what is wrong with you, I’m just not hungry?  Even in the rare circumstance that they have developed problems with food it’s totally not on you. I’m pretty sure you’d have to have a predisposition to EDs.   Also Diet culture, while exceedingly toxic, is very popular, especially at the moment, and for most people these (unhealthy) diets are just a fad.   Obviously I don’t know your current situation and I could be totally wrong and out of line but I guess what I’m trying to say is - please don’t blame yourself because I’m sure you are a wonderful person. Also you might wanna take my post with a grain of salt because well.. I’m currently hungover. Vodka is a hell of a drink...
